bestBHT.bht: In this captivating narrative, we witness the providential calling of Apollos to the ministry. His masterful and eloquent exposition of the Scriptures, along with his deep learning, proved to be of great value to the disciples. Although he spent some time there, Apollos departed, unaware that he would never return. This incident highlights the significance of his role in strengthening and establishing the disciples in their faith.

Henry Alford: We see in the providential calling of Apollos to the ministry, an instance of adaptation of the workman to the work.
A masterly exposition of the Scriptures by a learned Hellenist of Alexandria formed the most appropriate watering (1 Cor. iii. 6) for those who had been planted by the pupil of Gamaliel.

The word rendered eloquent may mean learned. But the former meaning is most appropriate here, both because the peculiar kind of learning implied by it, acquaintance with stories and legends, would not be likely to be predicated of Apollos,—and because the subsequent words, mighty in the Scriptures, sufficiently indicate his learning, and in what it lay.
Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: And after he had spent some time there—but probably not long.
he departed—little thinking, probably, he was never more to return to Antioch.
This is one of the most interesting and suggestive incidental narratives in this precious history.
Albert Barnes: He had been over these regions before, preaching the gospel.
Strengthening - Establishing them by exhortation and counsel.
Philip Schaff: After he had spent some time there...he departed on his third great missionary journey."
Strengthening all the disciples in the various churches founded by him and his companions.
Many things alluded to in the Galatian epistle...were suggested by notes made during this visit.
Archibald T. Robertson: Having spent some time... How long we do not know, probably not long.
He departed... alone Paul began the third mission tour without a Barnabas or a Silas.
Stablishing... as he did in the second tour.
John Gill: confirming them in the faith of Christ
fortifying their minds against the temptations of Satan
John Wesley: He went over the country of Galatia and Phrygia — It is supposed, spending about four years therein, including the time he stayed at Ephesus.

bhtAttempts.bht: In Acts 18:23, we see the providential calling of Apollos to the ministry and his masterly exposition of the Scriptures, which was most appropriate for those who had been planted by Gamaliel's pupil. Apollos was eloquent and mighty in the Scriptures, demonstrating his exceptional learning. After spending some time there, he departed, not realizing that he would never return to Antioch. This narrative is both interesting and suggestive, highlighting the significance of Apollos' work in strengthening the disciples and establishing them in their faith.

In this captivating narrative, we witness the providential calling of Apollos to the ministry. His eloquent exposition of the Scriptures, combined with his mighty understanding, was precisely what the disciples needed. Although he spent some time there, Apollos eventually departed, unaware that he would never return. This incident serves as a reminder of the importance of strengthening and establishing believers in their faith. Apollos played a crucial role in fortifying their minds against the temptations of Satan and confirming them in the teachings of Christ.

In an intriguing and suggestive narrative, we witness the unique calling of Apollos to the ministry. His masterful exposition of the Scriptures served as the perfect nourishment for those who were planted by Gamaliel's pupil. Apollos, both eloquent and deeply learned, spent some time there before departing, unaware that he would never return. This incident highlights the significance of his role in strengthening and establishing the disciples in their faith, fortifying their minds against the temptations they faced.

In Acts 18:23, we witness the providential calling of Apollos to the ministry, an instance of perfect adaptation of the workman to the work. His masterly exposition of the Scriptures, accompanied by his eloquence and deep learning, served as a significant source of instruction for the disciples. After spending some time there, Apollos departed, unknowingly marking the end of his time in Antioch. This intriguing and insightful narrative emphasizes the importance of his role in strengthening and establishing the disciples in their faith.

In this captivating narrative, we witness the providential calling of Apollos to the ministry. His masterful and eloquent exposition of the Scriptures, along with his deep learning, proved to be of great value to the disciples. Although he spent some time there, Apollos departed, unaware that he would never return. This incident highlights the significance of his role in strengthening and establishing the disciples in their faith.
